title: TypeError: find_distributions() got an unexpected keyword argument 'name'

content.raw:
Installer error which prevents install.

Chris Bounds \(Hons student\) is installing under anaconda3 on win10 and got:

Traceback \(most recent call last\):  
 File "setup.py", line 527, in <module>  
 function\(\*args\)  
 File "setup.py", line 477, in uninstall  
 from labscript\_utils.winshell import remove\_from\_start\_menu, launcher\_name  
 File "C:\\labscript\_suite\\labscript\_utils\\\_\_init\_\_.py", line 49, in <module>  
 from labscript\_utils.versions import get\_version, VersionException, check\_version  
 File "C:\\labscript\_suite\\labscript\_utils\\versions.py", line 196, in <module>  
 check\_version\('importlib\_metadata', '0.17', '2.0'\)  
 File "C:\\labscript\_suite\\labscript\_utils\\versions.py", line 174, in check\_version  
 version = get\_version\(module\_name, project\_name\)  
 File "C:\\labscript\_suite\\labscript\_utils\\versions.py", line 142, in get\_version  
 version = \_get\_metadata\_version\(project\_name, import\_path\)  
 File "C:\\labscript\_suite\\labscript\_utils\\versions.py", line 85, in \_get\_metadata\_version  
 dists = finder.find\_distributions\(name=project\_name, path=\[import\_path\]\)  
TypeError: find\_distributions\(\) got an unexpected keyword argument 'name'

Chris may have attempted to create a conda environment for labscript, using a packages list cloned from lab install.

Actually he only needs lyse on his laptop, but all the pip-install lyse attempts seem to not have progressed…
content.html:
Installer error which prevents install.

Chris Bounds (Hons student) is installing under anaconda3 on win10 and got:

Traceback (most recent call last):
File "setup.py", line 527, in <module>
function(*args)
File "setup.py", line 477, in uninstall
from labscript_utils.winshell import remove_from_start_menu, launcher_name
File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
from labscript_utils.versions import get_version, VersionException, check_version
File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\versions.py", line 196, in <module>
check_version('importlib_metadata', '0.17', '2.0')
File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\versions.py", line 174, in check_version
version = get_version(module_name, project_name)
File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\versions.py", line 142, in get_version
version = _get_metadata_version(project_name, import_path)
File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\versions.py", line 85, in _get_metadata_version
dists = finder.find_distributions(name=project_name, path=[import_path])
TypeError: find_distributions() got an unexpected keyword argument 'name'

Chris may have attempted to create a conda environment for labscript, using a packages list cloned from lab install.

Actually he only needs lyse on his laptop, but all the pip-install lyse attempts seem to not have progressed…
